1.10.4.2:
- Change: While the title remains the Module Installer, discussions with deft have led to this being rebranded as the new Legacy/Advanced Installer, replacing Deft's Pre-Rewrite v1.9.2.2 Installer.
- Backend: To comply with current Standards, Edge cases revolving around HTTP Urls have now been removed and HTTPS is now enforced.
	* Note: Those using 1.13.x should reinstall to apply these changes as HTTP Urls from others may 404 soon
- Fix: Fixed a Log issue with Installing the Client under latest version
- Backend: Major Code Refactors to Prepare for Integration to UI Rewritten Installer
- Backend: The Installer Codebase is now fully documented, feel free to hop into the source and learn more about the code!
- Backend: The Installer Codebase is now fully enforcing it's MIT License, whic is now included in the header of most of it's files
- Fix: Fixed a Race Case Issue in removeOldAristoisEntries that caused MultiMC Instance Patches to never be properly cleaned up
- Refactor: Removed Duplicated Code in removeOldAristoisEntries and refactor to ClientUtils#removeCachedEntries
- Refactor: AbstractJsonBuilder#generateMavenRepo -> Utils#generateMavenRepo
- Refactor: AbstractJsonBuilder#formatDate -> Utils#formatDate
- Fix: Fixed Null Tooltips being displayed for Client and Marketplace
- Refactor: InstallerUI#checkModLoaderSupport -> InstallerUI#syncAvailableData
- Change: Multiple UIs have converged into the Confirm Selection UI, via popular request
- Change: Changed Update Status Labels to look more user-friendly
1.10.4:
- Fix: Adjusted the --beta Command Argument to allow hotswapping between channels without a reinstall...unless you update to a newer beta version
- Change: All Exceptions are now logged fancily, though most of which are non-fatal errors
- Refactor: Main#logFancyException now can use Error Data properly
- Fix: Fixed an Issue where using the --beta argument would temporarily break updating due to a NumberFormatException
- Fix: Exception Names now properly logging in Fancy UIs
1.10.3:
- Change: FileChoosers will now open to the users home directory regardless of OS. Previously this produced odd behavior in rare cases.
- Refactor: Finals in ThemePalette and additional optimization
- Change: FileChooser Dialogs and error messages redesigned for parity with Deft's UI Installer
- Fix: Missing Print Statement for Manually Setting the .minecraft Directory
- Change: Added a field to JFileChooser methods in order to ensure validity of .minecraft and MultiMC Instance folders.
- Change: Dialogs will now display to warn a user if a folder selected is invalid for installation
- Fix: Fix Module Tooltips not being able to appear due to a race case issue
- Fix: NPE Fix in Utils#formatToHtml
- Change: Installation Progress and Completion Text revamped to be more user friendly
- Backend: -d Tag in Build Archives now -Donor to better represent Donor Status
- Change: Installer Window will now clearly display whether it's the donor version or not
- Backend: Code Cleanups
1.10.2.2: - Fix: Scrollbar Logic redesigned to work with the FileChooser UI properly and to be more accessible
1.10.2.1:
- Fix: 'marketplace' in the Module Selector is not capitalized
- Fix: Found Typo with deep clean procedure
- Fix: Image Data not properly cleared if switching between light or dark mode
- Change: 'Argument Configuration' UI now will use the most recently added image, currently 96x96 from 64x64
- Change: Added 'forceLowercase' argument to addBundleData to ensure specific marketplace addons are able to download properly if their name-cases are every changed but their dl location is not
- Change: Added Utility Method to scale Image Icon's whilst retaining Aspect Ratio
- Change: Scrollbars and Checkboxes within the Installer now show correct theming scheme
- Refactor: 'ThemePalette#images' -> 'ThemePalette#mainImages' for clarity
- Refactor: 'Utils#getMinecraftRoot' will now fancily log any exceptions instead of being potentially uncaught
- Change: Supports Release Candidate versions -> Dependency Upgrades
1.10.2:
- The UI has been fully revamped to align with the New UI Revamps seen in Deftware's v2 Installer
  * A New Font and Color Scheme has been applied throughout the Installers screens, as well as the File Selection Screen
  * '--lightMode [true|false]' flag added because it got requested during revamps
- Added a Hotfix to allow the Application Title to properly display in Linux's System Bar, instead of the app's class name
- Installer now has an Icon for the Jar Version, that scales depending on certain circumstances up to 92x92 at time of writing
- Fixed Issues with some Buttons being unable to highlight due to them being 'default buttons'
- Fixed Missing Title Assignment on JFrame Creation
- Added Additional Logging for some other Previously silent Exceptions
  * Includes exception for failing to retrieve donor status, Unix Exceptions
- More Code Cleanups from missed duplication in v1.10.0
- Options UI now adjusted to prevent false positive reloads and to actually save the current arguments for adjusting and retaining live data
1.10.0:
- The Marketplace Module Selector has received a facelift at long last:
  * Fabric/Forge/Rift/Snapshot Addons, depending on settings, will now properly install to your normal mods folder
  * Due to a funky race case issue, Selecting Forge blocked off Addon Installs. This has now been fixed.
  * There have been time anomolies where two marketplace jars can occupy the same space. This has been remedied
  * Multiple Logging Areas within Bundle Data Installations have been adjusted to show the filename they save as to prevent user confusion
  * Added a --excludeJsonAdjustment Flag to only update Addons. Be warned, as this can cause issues and is only made for advanced users
- Added a Return Home button to the Ending Installer Screen, allowing the user to return back without rebooting the application
- Fixed some Logging looking weird
- Major Cleanup Operations and Lambda Conversion Additions
1.9.9:
- Updated commons-io to 2.7
 - Java 8 now required to run Installer
- Fix a Race Case Bug where Aristois was able to update while EMC was not, causing crashes for those who didn't know
- Removed TODOs in some areas
 - removeOldAristoisEntries using lamdas now with Text Edits done to messages
- Added back extraLibs support, unused for now
1.9.8:
- Added an Identifier field to specify release type and display names on versions to fix Pre-Release and Experimental Version
- Fixed Marketplace Addon Integration to properly download addons again to the proper locations
- Marketplace Addons, if failed to download, will now display their source urls, like the queue message
- [Backend] Fixed Download Urls and Sync Version metadata
1.9.7:
- Added a Confirm Selection screen to confirm install
- Fixed Donor Installs yet again
- Added Notice field to Metadata for more information
1.9.6:
- Added Forge 1.15.2+ Support
- Added Beta Channel Support for future feature testing
1.9.5.8:
- excludeAutoUpdate function extended towards EMC and Aristois options
- Installer will now properly by default target the latest maven dependencies, if available
- Fixed a Race Case Issue with the Loader not attaching to maven if in a no-modloader setup
- Fixed Client references in code
- Fixed a possible issue with date formatting

Last Amended: 2020-04-08 @ 10:05 AM CST
1.9.5.7:
- Fixes an Incompatibility in some cases with MultiMC ModPack directories
- Fixed a Grammar issue in the wording of the Auto-Update non-support message
- Fixed cases of an *Extra Button* appearing when it shouldn't
1.9.5.6:
- Made an Exception in genConfigs log fancy-style
- Added a Download button to the update checker
- Fixed isLinux check to correspond to most, if not all Unix Platforms that are not a mac
1.9.5.5:
- Added a Warning that Auto Updating on Official ModLoaders does not work
- Block Aristois Loader Installing on Official ModLoader Setups when EMC couldn't auto-update
1.9.5.3: - Fixed a Critical bug with some files installing to the wrong places
1.9.5.2:
- Fixed MC Version Sorting to depend on Protocol. Snapshots and Experimental Versions will now order fine
- Fixed Updater Version Check inconsistency
1.9.5:
- Added gen Argument (Use --gen true in Options or CMD)
- Bug Fixes for 0 kb Jar Data
- Updated Dependencies
1.9.2:
- Added Update Checker
- Staility Fixes
- Some v1 Versions deprecated
